bestBHT.bht: The seed falling on rocky ground refers to a situation where there is a thin layer of earth covering a rock. This symbolizes those who hear the word of God but fail to let it take root in their hearts. They may hastily profess their belief without truly experiencing its power, resulting in hardened hearts. By contrasting this scenario with fertile ground, the passage emphasizes the importance of cultivating a receptive heart that nurtures the word of God to bring forth a fruitful life.

Jamieson-Fausset-Brown: The thing intended is, not ground with stones in it which would not prevent the roots striking downward, but ground where a quite thin surface of earth covers a rock."
John Gill: The word was preached to some persons who had hearts of stone, and which remained so.
A sudden and hasty profession of the word was made, without a powerful experience of it.
If it had [depth of earth], it would have been longer in coming up; more work would have been done by it, which would have required more time, before a profession of it had been made.

bhtAttempts.bht: The verse describes a scenario where the seed falls on rocky ground, where there is only a thin surface of earth covering a rock. The commentators suggest that this represents individuals who hear the word of God but do not allow it to take root in their hearts. They may make a hasty profession of faith without truly experiencing its power. Their hearts remain hardened, preventing the word from deepening and bearing fruit. This serves as a reminder to cultivate a receptive heart that allows the word of God to penetrate deeply and transform our lives.

The seed falling on rocky ground refers to a situation where there is a thin layer of earth covering a rock. This symbolizes those who hear the word of God but fail to let it take root in their hearts. They may hastily profess their belief without truly experiencing its power, resulting in hardened hearts. By contrasting this scenario with fertile ground, the passage emphasizes the importance of cultivating a receptive heart that nurtures the word of God to bring forth a fruitful life.

The seed falling on rocky ground represents a situation where a thin layer of earth covers a rock, hindering the growth of roots. This illustrates those who hear the word but do not allow it to take root in their hearts. Their hasty profession of faith lacks a transformative experience and results in hardened hearts. The passage uses this analogy to emphasize the importance of cultivating a receptive heart that allows the word of God to penetrate deeply and bear fruit in one's life.

The seed falling on rocky ground refers to ground with only a thin surface of earth covering a rock. This represents those who hear the word but do not let it take root in their hearts. Their hasty profession of faith lacks a powerful experience, resulting in hardened hearts. The verse serves as a reminder to cultivate a receptive heart that allows the word to penetrate deeply and bring forth transformative growth.

The seed falling on rocky ground represents individuals who hear the word of God but fail to let it take root in their hearts. Their hasty profession of faith lacks a powerful experience, resulting in hardened hearts. If the rocky ground had depth of earth, it would have taken longer for the seed to come up and more work would have been done before making a profession of faith. This passage reminds us to cultivate a receptive heart that allows the word of God to penetrate deeply and bear lasting fruit.
